leaving long tail to stitch on eye creating frog features select one panel of the frog body use pins to determine the placement of the eyes mine are in the 3rd row of tiles from the top edge and the 3rd in from each side for each eye insert a safety eye through the middle of one yarn circle use yarn needle and feed the middle yarn through the position for eye on frog body and then follow with safety eye attach back to the safety eye repeat for the second eye using the long tails on the eye circles stitch the eyes down to the body my favourite way is running stitch fasten_off yarn weave in ends use pins to mark the outline of a mouth with black yarn on the yarn needle work a mouth for the frog in backstitch fasten_off yarn weave in ends set all pieces aside frog body internal from stretch fabric cut two rectangles one for the front and one for the back use your completed crochet panels for measurements and add one cm seam allowance to each side from the wadding cut 2 rectangles to the same size as the fabric panels create a sandwich of fabric and wadding in the following order 2 rectangles of wadding on the bottom then the two fabric panels on top rights sides together pin the panels together and using sewing thread and sewing needle hand stitch the two longest sides and one short side of the rectangle turn the stitched piece through so that the two wadding pieces form a middle bag while the two fabric panels are now on the front and back if using doll stuffing beads carefully fill the bottom half of the fabric body omit if this is a toy for a small child on top of the beads insert a layer of wadding and then fill the remaining body will polyester fill until firm but not overstuffed you can substitute fabric scraps or yarn scrap as stuffing if preferred turn
